CatDescriptText: Luther Toland, miner, Homewood, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 21, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think that men should marry women within their own age bracket (not over fiver years difference) or do you approve of 'May and December' marriages?" answer reads: "...I don't see anything wrong with such a marriage if the two persons want to marry..."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Luther Toland wearing light colored unbuttoned polo shirt, standing on sidewalk in front of buildings and back facing woman
